content.en: Machine learning for defect prediction: Researchers have investigated various questions related to using algorithms for software defect prediction. They found that logistic regression performs best in most datasets, and combining feature selection and ensemble learning improves classification performance. Random Forests, Logistic Regression, and Kstar are identified as robust and stable classifiers. Data mining techniques can be used to predict software defects, and ensemble feature selection techniques improve defect detection. Machine learning algorithms are effective for defect detection and can address data imbalance and high dimensionality. Feature selection and ensemble learning techniques, as well as variant-based ensemble learning, can improve defect prediction. However, regression algorithms are inaccurate for predicting the precise number of defects. Overall, these findings highlight the potential of machine learning in automated defect identification and improving software quality.
content.da: Maskinlæring til defektforudsigelse: Forskere har undersøgt forskellige spørgsmål relateret til brugen af algoritmer til forudsigelse af softwaredefekter. De fandt, at logistisk regression præsterer bedst i de fleste datasæt, og at kombinationen af feature selection og ensemble learning forbedrer klassifikationspræstationen. Random Forests, Logistisk Regression og Kstar er identificeret som robuste og stabile klassifikatorer. Data mining teknikker kan bruges til at forudsige softwaredefekter, og ensemble feature selection teknikker forbedrer defektdetektion. Maskinlæringsalgoritmer er effektive til defektdetektion og kan håndtere dataubalancer og høj dimensionalitet. Feature selection og ensemble learning teknikker samt variantbaseret ensemble learning kan forbedre defektforudsigelsen. Dog er regressionsalgoritmer upræcise til forudsigelse af det præcise antal defekter. Overordnet set fremhæver disse fund potentialet ved maskinlæring i automatisk defektidentifikation og forbedring af softwarekvalitet.
